description.narrative: Reflora makes herbarium and archive information available through the authenticated Virtual Herbarium of Brazilian flora. Reflora includes the plants collected in Brazil and deposited in the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. This project includes the digitisation of these specimens but also a comprehensive capacity building programme for visiting Brazilian scholars.

To build capacity and resources to support Brazilian researchers to capture of economic and social benefit from Brazil’s diverse flora. Targets: 150 visitor weeks (Brazilian researchers at Kew) and 80,000 images of specimens transferred to Rio de Janeiro Botanic Garden
Reflora has the overall objective of making a significant contribution to the scientific and technological development of Brazil by means of researching, retrieving and using herbarium and archive information and making this information available by means of the authenticated Virtual Herbarium of the Brazilian Flora. Reflora includes the plants collected in Brazil and deposited in the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, and this project includes the digitisation of these specimens but also a comprehensive capacity building programme for visiting Brazilian scholars. This includes training in digitisation techniques, analysis of the collections, paper preparation for publication in peer-reviewed journals, research proposal development, and technical support for data capture and interpretation. This will be critically important for the effective and sustainable capture of economic and social benefit from Brazil’s diverse flora, and will go beyond the production of high-quality academic research, with benefits for national environmental policy, the economy and management of resources.
